Welcome to the **FCUL R Workshops** website. Workshop information and materials
will be posted here.

## Prerequisites

**Please bring a laptop with a fully charged battery to the workshops.**

**Download and install** the latest version of the following software **before** the first workshop:

+ [R Software](https://cran.r-project.org/)
+ [RStudio](https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/)

**Important:** At each we workshop we will provide links for you to download 
materials (e.g. workshop notes, exercises and solutions). For consistency and to help
us support you please:

1. Select a folder on your computer to work in (e.g. `Documents`)
2. Download and unzip the following file into your selected folder:
    + https://ilustat.com/shared/FCUL_R_2019w2/FCUL_R_2019w2.zip

## Workshop On-line Materials

+ **Workshop 1: Introduction to R** _(11 Oct 2019)_ <br>
  &nbsp; _Learn about the fundamentals of R thinking._ <br>
  &nbsp; _Practical exercises to understand the fundamentals of R ._
+ **Materials**
  + [Exercises: Base R Concepts](https://github.com/saghirb/R-datatable-Intro/raw/master/Exercises/Base-R/Base-R-Exercises.pdf)
  + [Solutions: Base R Concepts](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/saghirb/R-datatable-Intro/master/Exercises/Base-R/Base-R-Solutions.R)

+ **Workshop 2: Working with Datasets using data.table** _(18 Oct 2019)_ <br>

<br>

+ **Workshop 3: Creating HTML and PDF Documents using R Markdown** _(25 Oct 2019)_ <br>
